meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.text: These Rules may be cited as the High Court Fees Rules.

section.name: s1A
section.heading: Disapplication
section.content: These Rules do not apply in relation to a type or description of proceedings in the High Court if the fees payable in respect of that type or description of proceedings are specified in any other enactment.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Fees payable in the High Court

subsection.content: The fees respectively specified in the First and Second Schedules shall be payable in respect of all proceedings in any action or matter whatsoever in the High Court, whenever commenced. (25 of 1998 s. 2)

The Registrar may reduce, remit or defer payment of any fee specified in the First or Second Schedule as he may think fit in any particular case and shall in every case where he exercises this power endorse on the relevant document a note of such reduction, remission or deferment and the reason therefor.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Method of payment of fees
section.text: Unless otherwise in the Schedules provided, the said fees shall be payable by means of adhesive stamps, or by causing the relevant documents to be franked with the amount of fees.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Application to the Crown
section.text: These Rules shall apply to all proceedings by or against the Crown.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Transitional provision relating to the High Court Fees (Amendment) Rules 2008
section.leadIn: Where a party entitled to require any costs to be taxed has obtained an appointment to tax before the commencement* of rule 3(a) and (b) (the amending rule) of the High Court Fees (Amendment) Rules 2008 (L.N. 154 of 2008)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: nothing in the amending rule applies in relation to the taxation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: items 19 and 19a in the First Schedule as in force immediately before the commencement* of the amending rule continue to apply in relation to the taxation as if they had not been amended by the amending rule.

text.center: Commencement of a Cause or Matter

tr.td: a writ of summons (except a concurrent, renewed or amended writ);
(but no fee is payable on sealing of an originating document by which proceedings are instituted pursuant to leave granted under section 27A of the Ordinance) (L.N. 154 of 2008)

td.center: Entry or Setting Down for Trial in Court

tr.td: Setting down a cause or issue for hearing;
Setting down a civil appeal, motion or summons for hearing;
Entering a reference for hearing of an assessment of damages by the Registrar.
For every witness examined de bene esse by a judge or the Registrar, per day or part thereof
Attendance of a public officer to produce or prove in the High Court any record or document (25 of 1998 s. 2)
Attendance of a public officer to give evidence as an expert witness, per hour or part thereof
(or such other fee as is specially assessed by the judge or Registrar)
Attendance of a public officer to give evidence other than as an expert witness, per hour or part thereof
Attendance by the Registrar or officer outside the High Court (25 of 1998 s. 2)
Copy of documents typed in the Registry and certifying same, per page
Copy of a document made in the Registry, per page

td.p: No fee is payable for the copy if it is an electronic copy obtained from a designated information system: see rule 4 of the Court Proceedings (Electronic Technology) (High Court) (Electronic Fees) Rules. (L.N. 58 of 2025)

tr.td: Copy of a document made in the Registry and certification, per page (L.N. 58 of 2025)
Copy of a library book, per page (L.N. 58 of 2025)
Translation made in the Registry of a document from Chinese into English, or vice versa including certificate, per page
Transcription and translation made in the Registry, from Chinese into English, or vice versa, of a tape or recording including certificate, per page
Certifying translations made outside the Registry, from Chinese into English, and vice versa, per page
Certifying transcription made outside the Registry, from Chinese into English, and vice versa, of a tape or recording, per page
Search in the Registry, for each document or file referred to or required
Service of a document by a bailiff, per document
a writ of execution or writ of possession;
Watchman’s fee, per day or part thereof
Caretaker’s fee, per day or part thereof
Actual expenditure plus 20% thereof being administrative charges (L.N. 364 of 1992)

On the filing of a notice of commencement of taxation under Order 62, rule 21(1) of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A) or on any assessment or determination of costs pursuant to any court order or Ordinance (except assessment under Order 62, rule 9 or 9A of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A)), for every $100 or fraction of $100 of the amount claimed— (L.N. 154 of 2008)

Withdrawal of a bill of costs within 7 days after the application for setting down the taxation under Order 62, rule 21A(1) of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A) is made (L.N. 154 of 2008)
10% of the taxing fee which would be payable if the bill was to be allowed in full or $1,000 whichever is the less (L.N. 345 of 1989)
On the sale of a ship or goods in an admiralty case, for every $1,500 or part thereof of the price
Authentication of document by the Registrar
On sealing a notice in Form No. 80 in Appendix A of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A) filed under Order 50, rule 11(2) of those Rules (L.N. 364 of 1992; L.N. 58 of 2025)
On sealing an injunction order undertaken before commencement of a cause or an order made under section 21M of the Ordinance (L.N. 364 of 1992; L.N. 154 of 2008; L.N. 58 of 2025)
Registration of an enduring power of attorney (L.N. 283 of 1997)
Filing a notice of application for leave to institute or continue proceedings under Order 32A, rule 2 of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A)
Filing application (except an amended application) for probate or letters of administration or application for resealing of the same
Double or cessate probates, or cessate letters of administration or letters of administration de bonis non, or duplicate probates or letters of administration
Probate of a codicil, or letters of administration with a codicil to a will already proved (L.N. 364 of 1992)
Exemplification of a probate or letters of administration, in addition to the fees for engrossing
Engrossing wills and other documents, per page
Approving and settling administrator’s bond and filing
Making alteration in grant pursuant to order
Settling citation or abstract of citation for advertisement, per page
Any other matter or proceeding not herein specified—the same fee as charged from time to time in the First Schedule in respect of a similar matter or proceeding.

editorialNote.content: * This item is repealed by the Revenue (Abolition of Estate Duty) Ordinance 2005 (21 of 2005). For savings provision, please see section 40 of that Ordinance.
